intro: Brachystelma thunbergii, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and leaves, which help it retain water in arid environments. It produces vibrant, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Brachystelma thunbergii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and drought tolerance.
